description: VAPT Enforcer Pattern Library — maps all 125 VAPT risks to platform-specific enforcement configurations for Apache/.htaccess, WordPress (wp-config.php + PHP hooks), Nginx, fail2ban, Cloudflare, IIS, and Caddy.
purpose: Used by AI Agent to select correct implementation code per target platform with >90% accuracy.

syntax_rules: WAF Custom Rules use Cloudflare Ruleset Language (Wireshark-like expression syntax)
Transform Rules: HTTP Request/Response Header Modification
Rate Limiting Rules use 'ratelimit' action
Page Rules (legacy) — prefer newer Rules products
Worker snippets for complex logic
Zone ID and API Token required for API/Terraform deployment
XML format — all changes inside <configuration><system.webServer>
URL Rewrite module required for path-based rules
HTTP Headers via <httpProtocol><customHeaders>
Request Filtering via <security><requestFiltering>
Directory browsing via <directoryBrowse enabled='false' />
Method filtering via <verbs> section
Restart IIS Application Pool after changes (iisreset or App Pool recycle)
Caddyfile uses site block syntax: example.com { ... }
Named matchers: @name { path /... } then use respond @name 403
header directive for adding/removing response headers
respond directive for blocking with status code
reverse_proxy for proxy-level rules
Run 'caddy validate' before 'caddy reload'
No semicolons — newline-terminated directives

RISK-001.title: wp-cron.php Enabled Leads to DoS Attack

cloudflare.title: wp-cron.php Enabled Leads to DoS Attack
notes: wp-config.php change — enforced at PHP/WordPress layer. Cloudflare complements with rate limiting if applicable.

iis.title: wp-cron.php Enabled Leads to DoS Attack
notes: Original enforcer is not Apache/.htaccess — see original enforcer implementation.

caddy.title: wp-cron.php Enabled Leads to DoS Attack
notes: Original enforcer is not Apache — see original enforcer implementation.

RISK-002.title: Xmlrpc enabled Leads to Ping back attack

cloudflare.title: Xmlrpc enabled Leads to Ping back attack

waf_custom_rule.name: Block Xmlrpc enabled Leads to Ping back attack
waf_custom_rule.expression_note: Adjust path pattern to match exact file/path

iis.title: Xmlrpc enabled Leads to Ping back attack
iis.web_config_snippet:
<configuration>
  <system.webServer>
    <!-- VAPT RISK-002: Xmlrpc enabled Leads to Ping back attack -->
    <security>
      <requestFiltering>
        <hiddenSegments>
          <add segment="xmlrpc.php" />
        </hiddenSegments>
      </requestFiltering>
    </security>
    <staticContent>
      <clientCache cacheControlMode="NoControl" />
    </staticContent>
  </system.webServer>
</configuration>

caddy.title: Xmlrpc enabled Leads to Ping back attack

RISK-003.title: Username Enumeration via WordPress REST API

cloudflare.title: Username Enumeration via WordPress REST API

waf_custom_rule.name: Block Username Enumeration via WordPress REST API

iis.title: Username Enumeration via WordPress REST API
iis.web_config_snippet:
<configuration>
  <system.webServer>
    <rewrite>
      <rules>
        <!-- VAPT RISK-003: Username Enumeration via WordPress REST API -->
        <rule name="VAPT-RISK-003" stopProcessing="true">
          <match url=".*" />
          <conditions>
            <add input="{QUERY_STRING}" pattern="author=\d" />
          </conditions>
          <action type="CustomResponse" statusCode="403" statusReason="Forbidden" statusDescription="Access denied by VAPT rule" />
        </rule>
      </rules>
    </rewrite>
  </system.webServer>
</configuration>

caddy.title: Username Enumeration via WordPress REST API

RISK-005.title: Exposed WordPress Admin Username via Author Query

cloudflare.title: Exposed WordPress Admin Username via Author Query

waf_custom_rule.name: Block Exposed WordPress Admin Username via Author Query

iis.title: Exposed WordPress Admin Username via Author Query
iis.web_config_snippet:
<configuration>
  <system.webServer>
    <rewrite>
      <rules>
        <!-- VAPT RISK-005: Exposed WordPress Admin Username via Author Query -->
        <rule name="VAPT-RISK-005" stopProcessing="true">
          <match url=".*" />
          <conditions>
            <add input="{QUERY_STRING}" pattern="author=\d" />
          </conditions>
          <action type="CustomResponse" statusCode="403" statusReason="Forbidden" statusDescription="Access denied by VAPT rule" />
        </rule>
      </rules>
    </rewrite>
  </system.webServer>
</configuration>

waf_custom_rule.name: Block Information Disclosure via readme.html
waf_custom_rule.expression_note: Adjust path pattern to match exact file/path

iis.title: Information Disclosure via readme.html
iis.web_config_snippet:
<configuration>
  <system.webServer>
    <!-- VAPT RISK-011: Information Disclosure via readme.html -->
    <security>
      <requestFiltering>
        <hiddenSegments>
          <add segment="readme.html" />
        </hiddenSegments>
      </requestFiltering>
    </security>
    <staticContent>
      <clientCache cacheControlMode="NoControl" />
    </staticContent>
  </system.webServer>
</configuration>

caddy.title: Information Disclosure via readme.html

transform_rule.name: Strict-Transport-Security
transform_rule.cf_dashboard_path: Security > WAF > Transform Rules > Modify Response Header

iis.title: HSTS Not Implemented
iis.web_config_snippet:
<configuration>
  <system.webServer>
    <httpProtocol>
      <customHeaders>
        <!-- VAPT RISK-012: HSTS Not Implemented -->
        <add name="Strict-Transport-Security" value="max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload" />
      </customHeaders>
    </httpProtocol>
  </system.webServer>
</configuration>

caddy.title: HSTS Not Implemented

cloudflare.title: Directory Listing Enabled
notes: Handled server-side; Cloudflare cannot control Apache Options directives. Ensure origin is configured correctly.

iis.web_config_snippet:

    <!-- VAPT RISK-013: Directory Listing Enabled — Disable directory browsing -->
    <directoryBrowse enabled="false" />
  </system.webServer>
</configuration>

waf_custom_rule.expression_note: Adjust path pattern to match exact file/path

RISK-020.title: PHP File Execution in Uploads Directory

cloudflare.title: PHP File Execution in Uploads Directory

waf_custom_rule.name: VAPT RISK-020 - PHP File Execution in Uploads Directory
waf_custom_rule.expression_note: Customize expression to match specific path/query

iis.title: PHP File Execution in Uploads Directory
iis.web_config_snippet:
<!-- VAPT RISK-020: PHP File Execution in Uploads Directory -->
<!-- Manual IIS equivalent needed for: <Directory "/wp-content/uploads">
php_flag engine off
</Directory> -->
<!-- Consult IIS URL Rewrite module or Application Request Routing documentation -->
notes:
Manual IIS configuration required. Original Apache directive: <Directory "/wp-content/uploads">
php_flag engine off
</Directory>

caddy.title: PHP File Execution in Uploads Directory
caddy.caddyfile_snippet:
# VAPT RISK-020: PHP File Execution in Uploads Directory
# TODO: Caddy equivalent for: <Directory "/wp-content/uploads">
php_flag engine off
</Directory>
# See https://caddyserver.com/docs/
notes:
Manual Caddy Caddyfile configuration required for: <Directory "/wp-content/uploads">
php_flag engine off
</Directory>

    <httpProtocol>

cloudflare.title: Trace Method Enabled
notes: Handled server-side; Cloudflare cannot control Apache Options directives. Ensure origin is configured correctly.

iis.title: Trace Method Enabled
iis.web_config_snippet:
<configuration>
  <system.webServer>
    <!-- VAPT RISK-023: Trace Method Enabled — Block HTTP TRACE method -->
    <security>
      <requestFiltering>
        <verbs allowUnlisted="true">
          <remove verb="TRACE" />
          <add verb="TRACE" allowed="false" />
        </verbs>
      </requestFiltering>
    </security>
  </system.webServer>
</configuration>

caddy.title: Trace Method Enabled

notes: Manual IIS configuration required. Original Apache directive: ServerSignature Off

waf_custom_rule.name: VAPT RISK-025 - ETags Information Leakage
waf_custom_rule.expression_note: Customize expression to match specific path/query

iis.title: ETags Information Leakage
iis.web_config_snippet:
<configuration>
  <system.webServer>
    <!-- VAPT RISK-025: ETags Information Leakage — Remove ETag headers -->
    <staticContent>
      <clientCache cacheControlMode="NoControl" />
    </staticContent>
    <httpProtocol>
      <customHeaders>
        <remove name="ETag" />
      </customHeaders>
    </httpProtocol>
  </system.webServer>
</configuration>

caddy.title: ETags Information Leakage
